fields.description: We have a few instances now where JIRA runs out of memory. Examining heap dumps shows that 80% of memory is taken up by objects of class com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchResults$Page.  In two of the failures there have been about 25 million of these objects.
fields.summary: JIRA running out of memory with many SearchResults$Page objects

fields.description:

I shall try to contact support via chat.

fields.description:
Hello,

As a JIRA Studio administrator I would like a checkbox on the 'Add Project' screen that undertakes the steps in the [GreenHopper 101 guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+101] to get a new project configured quickly. Next to the checkbox should be some blurb and a link to the GreenHopper 101 page, for instance:

{quote}
Make this project agile with GreenHopper: (checkbox)
_GreenHopper is an agile project management tool for JIRA. Checking this box will complete the steps of the [GreenHopper 101 guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+101].
{quote}

Thank You.
Nick
fields.summary: Add 'Make my Project Agile' to the 'Add Project' screen

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to Studio.
2. GoTo issue tab and click "Advanced link". Suppose user was writing some query and autocomplete drop down is open.
3. Click on "User" or "History" drop down.

Result:
1. The JQL auto complete dropdown doesn't automatically get close and user sees two UI options at same time.

Expected:
1. Clicking on "User" or "History" should close any previously open dialog.
fields.summary: UI: JQL autocomplete dropdown doesn't get closed, when user click on user/history dropdown

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to Studio.
2. Create a dashboard and add some gadgets.
3. Try to share the dashboard.

Result:
1. There is no option "Share Dashboard" under the "Tools" dropdown.

Expected:
1. User should be able to share the dashboard.
fields.summary: User is not able to share dashboard

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to Studio.
2. Click "Create Issue" dialog.
3. Without dismissing the "Create issue" dialog, click on "User" or "History" drop down.

Result:
1. The create issue dialog doesn't automatically get closed and hence the "User" or "History" get hidden by it.

Expected:
1. Clicking on "User" or "History" should close any previously open dialog.
fields.summary: UI: "User" or "history" drop down get hidden by "Create Issue" dialog if open before.

fields.description:

2. Goto Dashboard and click "Add Gadget" link.

Result:

Expected:
1. Gadget directory should display gadgets in 2 column layout as on JAC
fields.summary: Gadget directory is getting displayed in one column layout.

fields.description:
We need to do a plugin compatibility check for all instances of JIRA on JIRA Studio.  Jeff has compiled this list of custom plugins installed on customers instances:

[JIRA plugins installed for Studio customers]

The things that we need to check:

* The version installed is compatible with JIRA 4
* The plugin doesn't clash with any existing bundled plugins in JIRA Studio (for example, some hosts have balsamiq 1.6.17, but JIRA is bundled with 1.6.14, this causes JIRA to fail to start)
fields.summary: Plugin compatibility check for Studio instances

Change the JIRA subnav to have dropdown menu, including "Dashboards", "Issues" (move "Filters" here) and "Agile" (for GH)

fields.description:
From customer:

{quote}
I'd like to make a suggestion concerning the header bar search
functionality.  We appreciate the goal of providing a global search
interface that produces consistently formatted results from an array of
different data sources.  However, we lament the lack of functionality in
its austere, lowest-common-denominator presentation, as compared with
data-specific search results.  Would it be possible to display each
section's search results in the native format of its data source?

Specifically, we'd like to see the Issue Navigator result table (columns
and all) under the "Issues" section of the header search results;
likewise, it would be great to see "Source" results presented in
FishEye's changeset format.  We don't yet use the Crucible or
Confluence, but I'm sure that their particular search results would
likewise be more useful under the "Reviews" and "Wiki" sections than
what is currently there.
{quote}
fields.summary: use application native search results format in global search
Split functional tests into 2 sets

fields.description: Jira 4 fails to deploy on jsam (aam).
fields.summary: Work with Contegix on Jira 4 deployment

fields.description:
Need JIRA Studio to accept authentication from an OpenID Provider other than CROWDID. 
This OpenID Provider would be a private enterprise customer OpenID Provider. 

The reason for this requirement is to enable JIRA Studio enterprise customers to leverage their central user authentication, provisioning/de-provisioning and account management process used for all applications hosted externally. Enterprise customers do not want the excessive overhead, varying levels of security and lack of single-identity/single-signon that results from deferring to the authentication and account management model specific to each externally hosted application. 

Need a hosted JIRA Studio instance to behave like an OpenID Relying Party that accepts authentication from a single or minimal white listed set of external OpenID provider(s). 

If JIRA Studio were a true OpenID Relying Party, I could see an account administrator back-channel process prior to first login with external OpenID (possibly manual to start) that would be needed to setup a user profile in the JIRA Studio CROWD directory that would contain the user's groups and roles for project specific access rights. Ideally, this profile setup could be automated through JIRA Studio exposure of the CROWD REST api ... http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Crowd+REST+APIs
fields.summary: JIRA Studio as a OpenID Relying Party with white list control over OpenID Providers

fields.description:
Since most powerpoints are created in Windows, many will probably use a few common fonts such as [Arial, Times New Roman, etc|http://web.nickshanks.com/fonts/microsoft-core-web-fonts].  Unfortunately, since Studio is hosted on Linux, it requires that we [install|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/intl/addingfonts.html] them to the JDK's install directory.

This is noted in the Confluence Office Connector [doc|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF210/Office+Connector+Limitations+and+Known+Issues], which also contains a link to where to download Microsoft Core fonts.
fields.summary: Need fonts installed in Studio for better Office Connector experience
Fix custom look and feel
Release SAL and merge back changes in JiraI18nResolver

fields.description:
I'm using JIRA Studio for the first time.
I decide I want to add a new Component to my project.
I click on "Help/Documentation", which takes me to JIRA Studio Documentation Home.
I look through the table of contents and find "Working with Issues".  This gives me almost no information.  I am very frustrated.
I enter "new component" in the Search box.  The message I get is "No results found for ancestorIds:103711852 AND new component. Please try one of the following suggestions"
What the hell is an "ancestorids"?  I didn't ask for that!
Next I just search for "component" and get the same result.
How in the world does the Help system know nothing about "component"????
I get very frustrated and decide that JIRA Studio has no useful documentation.

Later, when I've regained my composure, I try again.
I notice that there's a link to the JIRA User's Guide, which tells me how to add a new component.
I'm still baffled why the link from the Issues system within JIRA Studio takes me to a document that is of almost no use whatsover.
PLEASE FIX THIS.  The Help/Documentation link should take me to a useful document.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio Documentation is VERY limited

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to configure Default and US East availability zones in Bamboo Administration:
https://xxx.jira.com/builds/admin/elastic/image/configuration/viewElasticImageConfigurations.action

As we are using EU region AMI's, it woud be good to be able to explicitly access EU regions from JIRA Studio.
fields.summary: Enable Amazon EC2 EU availability zones in Bamboo
Make Crucible links rendered correctly

fields.description:
Upon creating an account (https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/Signup!default.jspa), the user's password is e-mailed to them in the clear. The user is given no indication that this will happen.

Generally, e-mailing plain text passwords is not a best practice. If passwords are being stored in plain text, then this is even worse. 

Forgotten passwords should be handled by sending a "Reset Password" token/link to the e-mail of record. Plain text passwords should never be exchanged insecurely (i.e. via e-mail) nor should they be persisted. The best practice is to store hashed versions of the password + salt.
fields.summary: Passwords e-mailed in plaintext

fields.description:
Jira4 tries to be smarter and when you search for {{ABC something}} where ABC is a project key, it will only search within ABC project. That breaks one test and contract proposed in AOD-1539.

It's not a major issue and for now I just commented out the test in TestStudioSearch.testQuickSearchWithinProject

fields.summary: Make studio-jira-fisheye-plugin work

fields.description:
As the title says, the Applinks configuration can fail during startup.  This can result in the following error if the user tries to make a new plan:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.applinks.StudioBridgedAppLink.(StudioBridgedAppLink.java:19)
at com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.applinks.StudioPlugins2BridgeImpl.getAppLinkForKey(StudioPlugins2BridgeImpl.java:30)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.studio.scm.AppLinksSvnRepository.getSvnAppLink(AppLinksSvnRepository.java:111)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.studio.scm.AppLinksSvnRepository.addDefaultValues(AppLinksSvnRepository.java:94)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.create.CreateBuild.doCreateBuild(CreateBuild.java:301)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invokeAction(DefaultActionInvocation.java:358)
{code}


Also, I see these errors in the Bamboo startup logs which may be related:

{code}
 com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablishmentException: Trust request FAILURE. 
Remote application https://xxxx.jira.com/source refused to trust our URL (https://xxxx.jira.com/builds). 
Response: 401 URL https://xxxx.jira.com/builds is not present in application links, and request not authenticated as an administrator. 
Check the base URL of the caller and ensure the target application has a matching application link entry. Response code: [401]
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablisher$1.handle(TrustEstablisher.java:133)
       at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.execute(HttpClientRequest.java:246)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablisher.askForTrust(TrustEstablisher.java:121)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablisher.askForTrust(TrustEstablisher.java:98)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablisher.pollTrustedApp(TrustEstablisher.java:86)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.TrustEstablisher.setUpTrustedApps(TrustEstablisher.java:72)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultAppLinksManager.getApplicationInstances(DefaultAppLinksManager.java:222)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultAppLinksManager.getKeyAssociations(DefaultAppLinksManager.java:114)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultAppLinksManager.getLinkedApplication(DefaultAppLinksManager.java:480)
       at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultAppLinksManager.linkProjectToRemoteApp(DefaultAppLinksManager.java:514)
       at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor222.invoke(Unknown Source)
       at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
       at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
       at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
       at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
       at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
       at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
       at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
       at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
       at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
       at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
       at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
       at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
       at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)

fields.summary: Bamboo Upgrade Task configuring Applinks can fail
Subversion repository manager appears unable to revoke permissions granted at a higher path
Update log4j.properties to match Jira4
User management pages doesn't work at all

fields.description: When runninng studio integration tests, data is restored multiple times and memory leaks in each restoration in JIRA 4. Currently we're throwing 1G perm gen to it. We need to identify where the leaks are and apply fixes.
fields.summary: Identify and fix memory leaks in studio plugins in JIRA 4

fields.description: Studio comes with the JIRA Confluence portlet enabled, which displays a Confluence page on the JIRA dashboard.  Unfortunately due to a [bug|https://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JCP-3], Confluence images are broken.
fields.summary: Images broken in JIRA Confluence portlet

fields.description:
In JIRA 3, when browsing to a project, there is an "Administer Project" link on the page.
In JIRA 4, this link is there no more. Instead, the "Administration" dropdown on the top nav bar has a menu item "Administer {project name}".
We need to display the "Administer project" link in Studio's top nav bar after "Browse Projects" and "Find Issues". The link should only be present if there is a current selected project.
The menu item should be shown only if the user has permissions to administer the selected project.
fields.summary: Add "Administer project" link to JIRA's top navigation bar

fields.description:
Currently, the default file location is "/data/jirastudio/svn/root/conf/authz", as defined in SvnRepositoryPermissionsAccessorImpl.DEFAULT_CONFIG_FILE_LOCATION.

This results in excessive error logging in integration test because the default location is used everytime JIRA is restored.

It should probably be replaced by appLinksManager.getPrimaryApplication(SVN).getUrl() + "/conf/authz".
fields.summary: Repository manager's svn config file location has a hard-coded default location, which should be replaced by a relative path to the SVN base url, which uses a file protocol.
Fix exports and dependencies of applinks-jira-plugin

fields.description:
The TST project is restored from xml.
The "Wiki", "Source" and "Review" tabs are missing after upgrading to JIRA4.
In project administration, the project links to Confluence, Fisheye and SVN are lost.
The "Build" tab and project link are still there, only because the project link was not in the xml backup, but was created as part of bamboo upgrade.

So we need to make sure the project links to Confluence, Fisheye, SVN and Bamboo are all preserved.
fields.summary: Project links for existing projects are lost

fields.description: Drag and drop features in GreenHopper are broken due to action aliases clash with studio's own repository-manager-plugin.
fields.summary: Action aliases clash with GreenHopper
Subversion permission manager breaks when a group has been deleted

fields.description:
On Ubuntu 9.04, the default Subversion 1.5.4 client does not seem to trust our *.jira.com certificate:

{noformat}
☧ svn ls https://stage.jira.com/svn
Error validating server certificate for 'https://stage.jira.com:443':
 - The certificate is not issued by a trusted authority. Use the
   fingerprint to validate the certificate manually!
Certificate information:
 - Hostname: *.jira.com
 - Valid: from Thu, 15 Oct 2009 22:43:48 GMT until Fri, 15 Oct 2010 22:43:48 GMT
 - Issuer: 07969287, http://certificates.godaddy.com/repository, GoDaddy.com, Inc., Scottsdale, Arizona, US
 - Fingerprint: a5:bc:b6:f7:fb:fd:44:33:bf:a7:66:fc:13:4b:b5:ee:22:cd:6b:fa
(R)eject, accept (t)emporarily or accept (p)ermanently? 
{noformat}

However Firefox trusts it, and a Subversion 1.6 client on CentOS trusts it too.
fields.summary: *.jira.com SSL certificate not trusted by 1.5.x Subversion clients
Mixed-case Subversion URL does not work in Studio 1.8.3

fields.description:
Studio, unlike Confluence Standalone, doesn't allow users within the confluence-administrators group to administrator spaces, whereas in Confluence standalone, this [works|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Space+Permissions+Overview].  This is useful if:

* User has accidentally removed all permissions from a space
* Support has imported a space from Confluence and the groups have not all yet been imported.  Enabling this allows users to "touch-up" the permissions on the spaces.
fields.summary: Members of administrators group can't administer spaces that have no permissions

fields.description: When editing a project's avatar (either editing existing project or adding a new project), the page is duplicated and appended to the current page, the model dialog is missing a piece, and after selection, the throbber does not stop spinning.
fields.summary: Fix UI issue related to editing a project's avatar

fields.description:
The dropdown shadows generated for project menu dropdown, user menu dropdown and history menu dropdown are all out of place.
Currently there is not AUI dropdown shadown in other apps.
I suggest to disable or hide them.
fields.summary: Fix AUI dropdown shadow

fields.description:
Studio now provides a mechanism to let users change permissions for arbitrary Subversion paths.   After entering the path they wish to manage, a new row in a table appears with a 'Configure' link.

However once a path is has custom permissions set, there is no way to say "I no longer wish to explicitly configure permissions here; just use the defaults".  The row is there, permanently in the table, even if the path it refers to has been deleted in Subversion.  This is potentially confusing to admins.
fields.summary: Provide a way to remove Subversion per-path permissions
Show project avatar in the project menu dropdown
Make JIRA4's create issue inline dialog work in Studio

fields.description: On test.jira.com and StAC, the builds tab does not appear in some or all projects. One theory is that if a project has custom tabs, it screws up the Builds tab addition.
fields.summary: Builds tab not displaying in projects

fields.description: For 2.0, would like Builds to be hidden by default. It can still be running, upgrade tasks etc. should be run, but we should not allow it to be used until the customer has proactively enabled Bamboo in their admin console.
fields.summary: Allow customers to enable/disable Bamboo from Studio admin

fields.description: Our illustrious build engineer thinks there may be problems with the Bonnie 2.3 jar and recommends we upgrade.
fields.summary: Upgrade Bonnie
Exception when XStream tries to deserialise DefaultApplicationLink class
Make applications link renderrs work again (links to confluence page, fisheye revision and source file don't work at the moment)

fields.description: If a workflow has multiple transitions named *Close*, and you attempt to map this transition using the Commit Command Mapper, it will only add the property string *commit.command.mapping* to one of them.
fields.summary: Commit Command Mappings do not set for transitions with the same name

fields.description:
Stacktrace:
Oct 20, 2009 2:50:30 PM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor process
SEVERE: Error finishing response
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

fields.summary: Tomcat logs heaps of java.lang.ArrayIndexoutofBoundsException
Fix global admin path mapping
Find out why there is an export of com.atlassian.studio.fisheye.servlet* package  in studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/pom.xml
